docs.lead_paragraph: A former nuclear engineer on Tuesday was convicted of murder for poisoning his wife with a lethal dose of nicotine in Southern California in 1994.

docs.lead_paragraph: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio signed an executive order on Tuesday to raise the minimum hourly wage by more than a dollar to $13.13 for potentially thousands of people working in the city.

headline.main: New York Mayor Orders Higher Minimum Wage for Thousands in City
headline.print_headline: New York Mayor Orders Higher Minimum Wage for Thousands in City

docs.lead_paragraph: Some of the health-insurance subsidies being offered under the Affordable Care Act represent an "abuse of discretion" by the federal government, a federal judge in Oklahoma ruled Tuesday, marking another volley in a years-long legal fight that could eventually reach the U.S. Supreme Court.

headline.main: Judge: Health Care Subsidies 'Abuse of Discretion'

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. doctors and teaching hospitals received $3.5 billion from pharmaceutical companies and medical device makers in the last five months of 2013, according to the most extensive data trove on such payments ever made public.

headline.main: Drug, Medical Device Companies Paid Billions to U.S. Physicians, Hospitals in 2013: Data

docs.abstract: Mayor de Blasio plans to sign an executive order expanding New York City’s living wage law. Macy’s is hiring for the holidays. How to lose $1 million a month.

docs.lead_paragraph: New York Mayor Bill de Blasio plans to expand the city's living wage measure to include thousands of additional workers, as well as increase the amount workers are paid under the law, the New York Times reported on Monday.

headline.main: New York Mayor De Blasio Plans Expansion of Living Wage: NYT
headline.print_headline: New York Mayor De Blasio Plans Expansion of Living Wage: NYT

docs.snippet: New York Mayor Bill de Blasio plans to expand the city's living wage measure to include thousands of additional workers, as well as increase the amount workers are paid under the law, the New York Times reported on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s ad attacks his Republican opponent, Rob Astorino, about dental services and prescription drug coverage for seniors.

headline.print_headline: Astorino Interview Used in Attack Over Health Care
headline.content_kicker: The Ad Campaign: New York Governor

docs.abstract: Ad Campaign column examines television ad by Democratic Gov Andrew M Cuomo's campaign attacking Republican challenger Rob Astorino over health care.
docs.snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s ad attacks his Republican opponent, Rob Astorino, about dental services and prescription drug coverage for seniors.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio plans to sign the order, which also raises the hourly wage, on Tuesday. The administration estimates that about 18,000 wage earners will be affected.

headline.main: De Blasio’s Executive Order Will Expand Living Wage Law to Thousands More
headline.print_headline: Mayor’s Executive Order Will Expand Living Wage Law to Thousands More

docs.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio will sign an executive order significantly expanding New York City’s living wage law, covering thousands of previously exempt workers and raising the hourly wage itself, to $13.13 from $11.90, for workers who do not receive benefits; order will immediately cover employees of commercial tenants on projects that receive more than $1 million in city subsidies.
docs.snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio plans to sign the order, which also raises the hourly wage, on Tuesday. The administration estimates that about 18,000 wage earners will be affected.
